FuncDef: This command implicitly enables Pool Fate-Sharing Group (PFSG) which is required in case of multiple NAT policies per inside routing context. A NAT pool configured with this command will not advertise or monitor any route in order to change its (activity) state but instead it will directly follow the state of the lead pool in the PFSG. Once the lead pool changes its (activity) state, all the remaining pools following the lead pool will change their state accordingly.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the routing instance where the lead pool resides. Values-<router-name> | <service-id>.
Specifies the pool whose activity state is being shared up to 32 characters in length.
